intro: Scleria sororia, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along riverbanks. Its slender, grass-like stems are often clustered and have a distinct triangular cross-section. Scleria sororia produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the Cyperaceae family.
